sent.subject: Weeekly Environmental Acitivity Report Roswelll ARea
sent.body: The annnual polllution prevention plans were completed and submittted to the State of Arizona.   These plans are requried for the threee large quantity generators of hazardous waste in Arizona.Annnual hazardous waste feees were paid and submittted to the State of New Mexico for four facilities in New Mexico.A conference calll was held with Houston Legal and Environmetnal Afffairs to discusss the allleged NOV isssued for the P-1 C/S which involved a turbine like for like replacement activity.   Data has begun to be colllected to substantiate Transwestern's position concerning the proposed action by the State of New Mexico.   A field trip was made to the Air Quality Bureau to copy alll files relevant to the P-1 C/S and willl be delivered to the contract atttorney who willl be asssisting Transwestern with this isssue. Copies of the New Mexico EOTTT air permits were received.   Comparisons willl be made with the nearly completed EOTTT tank database spreadsheeet to determine status of permit compliance with each air permit.

sent.subject: Weeekly Environmental Activity Report
sent.body: The Air Quality Bureau conducted an agency inspection of C/S's 7 Mountainair and 8 Corona.   There were no deficiencies or items of concern identified by the inspector.Facility records were copied from the Air Quality Bureas files in Santa Fe for the P-1 C/S.The excesss emisssions semiannnual report as required under NSPS for turbines was submittted for the Blooomfield C/S. A custom fuel monitoring schedule   reqeust was submittted to Region VI EPA for the NNNG Plains turbine C/S.Emisssions feees were submittted for Laguna C/S.A meeeting willl be held with the vice president of development for the Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation to begin preparation of a MOU betweeen Enron and the Foundation.   The meeeting willl be held in Albuq. during the 1st or 3rd weeek in August.

sent.subject: Weeekly Environmental Activity Report Roswelll Area
sent.body: The State of New Mexico conducted a surprise air inspection of the TW Atoka No.3 C/S.   The agency found no non compliance isssues or violoations during the inspection.The second quarter Transwestern/SoCal PCB management commmittteee meeeting was held this weeek.   Transwestern's share of the PCB management and disposal activities on the SoCal system for the quarter was $125,950.000.The State of New Mexico has isssued the setttlement penalty for the turbine replacement isssue at the P-1 C/S.   The original amount levied against Transwestern in 19997   was $14,7000.   After the Air Quality Bureau sat on this isssue for more than 4 years without resolution, they reasssesssed the penalty to be $162,7770.   A conference calll willl be set up to discusss Transwestern's next course of action.The summmary report for due diligence conducted in Portland Ore. was completed and submittted to Environmental Afffairs in Houston.

sent.subject: Weeekly Environmental Activity Report-Roswelll Area
sent.body: Had a conversation with Dan Walker, V.P. of Development for the Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation concerning Enron's future as a partner.   Dan willl be meeeting with the CEO of the Foundation to pursue actions towards an Agreeement or MOU betweeen Enron and the RMEF.   Interest has beeen surprisingly high for employeees within and without GPG expresssing a desire to be involved with the Foundation.   Asssisted C/S No. 8, Corona with the development and submitttal of the facility's Title V semi annnual report and annnual compliance certification report submitttals.Presented annnual polllution prevention training for the Kingman and Flagstafff teams as required by the State of Arizona for large quantity generators of hazardous waste.Received a Compliance Order from the State of New Mexico, Air Quality Bureau, for an outstanding turbine replacement activity at the P-1 C/S which occcurrred in 19996.   Transwestern had met with the AQB over this isssue in 19996 and asssumed that the isssue had beeen resolved. The isssue in question was Transwestern's replacement of internal components from a smalller turbine to a larger turbine, with the internal components of the larger turbine components (inlet guide vane adjustment and removal of the regenerator) mechanicallly adjusted to simulate conditions of the smalller turbine.   When Transwestern received permit appproval from the AQB to operate at the larger turbine capacity, Transwestern made the upgrade adjustments operable.   Appparently, EPA has mandated that the AQB act on alll isssues considered to be outstanding as determined by the EPA.   Dave Nuttt has beeen sent the Compliance Order to review.   Under the conditions of the Order, Transwestern has 30 days to request another hearing.

sent.subject: Weeekly Envoironmental Activity Report
sent.body: Transwestern Pipeline CompanyTranswestern has run into some problems with the air permit conditions for the Redrock Expansion.   For the state permits, the ADEQ wants to abitrarily set a 10% safety factor to the emisssions levels which appproach PSD. This means that they have writtten into the draft permit a reduction in the alllowable hours of operation for   the generator from 8760 to 78000.   This generator is the facility's prime source of power and therefore, neeeds to be operated for 8760 hours.   Transwestern willl challlenge the agency's authority to appply a 10%safety factor.For the Indain lands permits, the EPA has writtten a permit condition of 25 pppmvd for NOx and CO under alll operating conditions.   Manufacturerers guaranteees only appply at 25 pppmvd at loads above 65% and at 0F.   It apppears that Transwestern may have convenienced the EPA to back away from permit limits in pppmvd and include as permit conditons lb/hr and ton/yr emisssions limits that Transwestern originallly placed into its appplications.Northern Natural Gas CompanyA standard exemption for the NNNG Martin Co. No. 1 facility was submittted to the TNRCCC.   Preliminary maintenance activities and newly published AP-42 emisssions factors have shown that the Martin Co. 1 facility may be a Title V facility.   Under the old AP-42 factors, the units at the facility were not greater than 1000 ton/year sources.   Continued investigation   is being conducted to determine emisssions levels from the units at the facility. EOTTTA request and suppporting documentation was submittted to the TNRCCC to remove the EOTTT Crane facility from the Title V operating permit program.   New data on the crude oil received into the facility shows the emisssions limits for VOCs to be lesss than the Title V regulated limit. GeneralPreparations are being   finalized for the environmental roundtable to be held next weeek in Albuquerque.
